channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Simple Solutions to Big Problems
item.description: Me, I get excited by shiny things. I played with Maypole before Catalyst or Mojolicious was a thing, and I wrote some mean Class::DBI code before DBIx::Class took over the Perl ORM business.

item.title: London-based Perl developer? Free Â£10,000 payrise (individual results may vary)
item.description: Over the New Year, the majority of Perl employers in London decided they were voraciously hiring. At the same time, apparently, most Perl developers decided to scuttle â€” hermit-crab-like ðŸ¦€ðŸš â€” away from the active job market.

item.title: Do you hate your bank? Help disrupt Financial Services in London
item.description: If thereâ€™s any industry that desperately needs more friendly technology and whose consumers are long-overdue the bounty offered by a Modern Perl technology stack, itâ€™s finance.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: I attended Gotanda.pm
item.description: A meeting report on Gotanda.pm, including slides from a talk about writing Perl with W0rp/ale.

item.title: London Perl Monger - Tech Meet #1
item.description: Mohammad attended the Tech Meet, and found it very useful!

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop
item.description: September 7-8, 2018 Bern.

item.title: The Perl Conference in Europe
item.description: August 15-17, 2018, Glasgow. The Call for Papers is open.

item.title: The Perl Conference in North America
item.description: June 17-22, 2018, Salt Lake City.

item.title: French Perl Workshop
item.description: May 18-19, 2018, Paris.

item.title: A decade of classes in Lausanne
item.description: May 14-18, 2018, Lausanne. Five trainig classes by Damian.

item.title: Presentation Aikido
item.description: May 8-9, 2018, Budapest. Presentation Aikido by Damian and lots of other workshop at the Craft Conference.

item.title: GPW2018 - German Perl Workshop
item.description: April 4-6, 2018, Gummersbach.

item.title: Interviews with Perl Developers
item.description: 10 Interviews with Perl Developers from 2013. Now listed on one page.

item.title: Interview with a Perl Developer: Randal Schwartz
item.description: Merely calling Randal a 'Perl Developer' doesn't tell the half of everything he has done for Perl over the years. In this interview, we peek into Perl history, some prognostication about where Perl is headed, and what Randal is up to these days.

item.title: How to find a programming topic to write about
item.description: David encourages folks to write more technical articles. There's some fantastic advice in here!

item.title: ALTLR4::Grammar v0.1.0 to Perl 6 CPAN
item.description: Jeff has released a module to convert ANTLR4 lexer/parser grammars tfom ANTLR to Perl 6.

item.title: 2018.13 Apply Perl 6
item.description: The weekly roundup of Perl 6 news, detailing core work, blog posts, and news about upcoming tutorials and presentations

item.title: Two New Modules
item.description: Dave's preparations for a talk for the London Perl Mongers exposed a couple of bits that could be turned into new modules for CPAN.

item.title: Easy data validation in Perl with Regexp::Common
item.description: On Sawyer's recommendation, I take a look at this module for making consistent regexes for data validation

item.title: Programming the Raspberry Pi with Perl; eBook fundraiser
item.description: Steve announces that the fundraiser for a new eBook has started.

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: March 5-25
item.description: A summary of recent activity on P5P, including grant reports, news, issues and discussions.

item.title: #349 - Conference season is upon us!
item.description: Conference season is coming up; we've got a lot of great events for you to check out and attend if you're able, plus all the latest bits from here and there around the 'Net. Enjoy!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
